protocol_name: Extraction of genomic DNA from diatoms by the modified method described in (Jacobs et al., 1992)
protocol_name_html: Extraction of genomic DNA from diatoms by the modified method described in (Jacobs et al., 1992)
description: A protocol for diatom DNA extraction used in the Limnological Institute SB RAS for freshwater diatoms.
protocol_affiliation: Limnological Institute of Siberian Branch of Russian Academy of Sciences,Institute of Chemical Biology and Fundamental Medicine of Siberian Branch of Russian Academy of Sciences

status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

components.data: The cells were sedimented on polycarbonate filters (5-μm pores) (Whatman, USA), briefly rinsed with cold Diatom Medium (DM), harvested by centrifugation for 2 min at 16,100 g at 4 °С and then stored at −70 °С.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The cells were sedimented on polycarbonate filters (5-μm pores) (Whatman, USA), briefly rinsed with cold Diatom Medium (DM), harvested by centrifugation for 2 min at 16,100 g at 4 °С and then stored at −70 °С.

components.data: DNA was precipitated by adding 1/10 volume of 3 M sodium acetate, pH 5.2, and 1 volume of isopropanol to the aqueous phase. The solution was matured at 0 °С for 1 h and then centrifuged (30 min, 16,100 g, 4 °С). The supernatant was removed, and the precipitate was twice rinsed with 70% ethanol, dried in air and dissolved in sterile TE buffer (10 mM Tris-HCl; 1 mM Na2EDTA, pH 8.0).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: DNA was precipitated by adding 1/10 volume of 3 M sodium acetate, pH 5.2, and 1 volume of isopropanol to the aqueous phase. The solution was matured at 0 °С for 1 h and then centrifuged (30 min, 16,100 g, 4 °С). The supernatant was removed, and the precipitate was twice rinsed with 70% ethanol, dried in air and dissolved in sterile TE buffer (10 mM Tris-HCl; 1 mM Na2EDTA, pH 8.0).

components.data: A 4.5 mL volume of lysis buffer (20 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8.0; 100 mM NaCl; 50 mM Na2EDTA), 20% SDS (250 μL) and proteinase К (250 μL, 10 mg/mL) were added to 1 g of frozen cells, which were then incubated for 2 h at 60 °С with intermittent mixing. Then 250 μL of proteinase K (10 mg/mL) were added again, and the cells were incubated for 40 min under the same conditions.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: A 4.5 mL volume of lysis buffer (20 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8.0; 100 mM NaCl; 50 mM Na2EDTA), 20% SDS (250 μL) and proteinase К (250 μL, 10 mg/mL) were added to 1 g of frozen cells, which were then incubated for 2 h at 60 °С with intermittent mixing. Then 250 μL of proteinase K (10 mg/mL) were added again, and the cells were incubated for 40 min under the same conditions.

components.data: The lysate was mixed for 10 min with 8 mL of phenol saturated with TE buffer, pH 8.0 using the tube rotator. The extract was centrifuged (10 min, 16,100 g, 20 °С), then the aqueous phase was taken and again mixed with an equal volume of phenol: chloroform: isoamyl alcohol mixture (25:24:1). It was then mixed and centrifuged under the same conditions. The aqueous phase was mixed with a chloroform: isoamyl alcohol mixture (24:1), mixed and centrifuged under the same conditions. Aqueous phase was used for the subsequent stages.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The lysate was mixed for 10 min with 8 mL of phenol saturated with TE buffer, pH 8.0 using the tube rotator. The extract was centrifuged (10 min, 16,100 g, 20 °С), then the aqueous phase was taken and again mixed with an equal volume of phenol: chloroform: isoamyl alcohol mixture (25:24:1). It was then mixed and centrifuged under the same conditions. The aqueous phase was mixed with a chloroform: isoamyl alcohol mixture (24:1), mixed and centrifuged under the same conditions. Aqueous phase was used for the subsequent stages.
